code: aedes_vt <- aedes_vt |> head(5) aedes_responses <- aedes_vt |> fetch() aedes_responses[[1]] ## <httr2_response> ## GET https://vectorbyte.crc.nd.edu/portal/api/vectraits-dataset/474/?format=json ## Status: 200 OK ## Content-Type: application/json ## Body: In memory (52292 bytes)

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: Now list responses, can extract relevant data using glean() function. dataset bit large print , often may want columns data rather whole dataset. Fortunately cols argument allows us filter data easily. can also use argument returnunique instruct ohvbd return unique rows. let’s get just unique locations trait name combinations data using command :
code: aedes_data <- aedes_responses |> glean() cat("Data dimensions: ", ncol(aedes_data), " cols x ", nrow(aedes_data), " rows") ## Data dimensions:  157  cols x  874  rows aedes_data_filtered <- aedes_responses |>   glean(     cols = c("Location", "OriginalTraitName"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) aedes_data_filtered ## <ohvbd.data.frame> ## Database: vt ##   DatasetID                      Location OriginalTraitName ## 1       474                Marilia Brazil    fecundity rate ## 2       475                Marilia Brazil         longevity ## 3       148      Unversity of Georgia USA  glycogen content ## 4       578            Fort Myers Florida  development time ## 5       556 Guadeloupe French West Indies gonotrophic cycle

text: day--day use, mostly find using functions together create small pipelines. typical pipeline likely contain lines code: similar pipeline taking advantage autofiltering search_hub() might look like :
code: df <- search_hub("Aedes aegypti") |>   filter_db("vt") |>   head(5) |>   fetch() |>   glean(     cols = c("Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Latitude", "Longitude"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) head(df) ## <ohvbd.data.frame> ## Database: vt ##   DatasetID Interactor1Genus Interactor1Species  Latitude Longitude ## 1       474            Aedes            aegypti -22.21389 -49.94583 ## 2       475            Aedes            aegypti -22.21389 -49.94583 ## 3       148            Aedes            aegypti        NA        NA ## 4       578            Aedes            aegypti  26.61667 -81.83333 ## 5       556            Aedes            aegypti  16.25000 -61.58333 df <- search_hub("Aedes aegypti", db = "vt") |>   head(5) |>   fetch() |>   glean(     cols = c("Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Latitude", "Longitude"),     returnunique = TRUE   )

title: Retrieving data from VectorByte
text: One subtlety VectorByte (particular) field collisions. Let’s imagine looking traits whitefly species (Bemisia). can just construct query investigate follows: Now expect traits Bemisia spp, however look Interactor1Genus column see something touch odd: Axinoscymnus ladybird, appearing? Let’s look rows containing Axinoscymnus: scenario, Bemisia present dataset, “target” rather animal trait referring . might want specific precisely data retrieve. Enter search_x_smart() family functions. allow construct specific search. let’s construct search wanting , smart search. made sure search Interactor1Genus column. gotten back Bemisia traits! sort collision particularly common “Citation” column, papers may mention multiple trait names. search_x_smart() functions many different operators columns can work upon. full details, run ?search_vt_smart ?search_vd_smart console. general always worthwhile inspecting data retrieve make sure query returned data thought .
code: df <- search_hub("Bemisia", "vt") |>   head(6) |>   fetch() |>   glean(     cols = c(       "DatasetID",       "Interactor1Genus",       "Interactor1Species",       "Interactor2Genus",       "Interactor2Species"       )     ) unique(df$Interactor1Genus) ## [1] "Axinoscymnus" "Bemisia" df |> dplyr::filter(Interactor1Genus == "Axinoscymnus") |> head() ## <ohvbd.data.frame> ## Database: vt ##   DatasetID Interactor1Genus Interactor1Species Interactor2Genus ## 1       160     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 2       160     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 3       160     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 4       160     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 5       160     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ## 6       160     Axinoscymnus         cardilobus          Bemisia ##   Interactor2Species ## 1             tabaci ## 2             tabaci ## 3             tabaci ## 4             tabaci ## 5             tabaci ## 6             tabaci df <- search_vt_smart("Interactor1Genus", "contains", "Bemisia") |>   head(6) |>   fetch() |>   glean(     cols = c(       "DatasetID",       "Interactor1Genus",       "Interactor1Species",       "Interactor2Genus",       "Interactor2Species"       )     ) unique(df$Interactor1Genus) ## [1] "Bemisia"

code: library(ohvbd)  ad_df <- fetch_ad(metric = "temp", gid = 0, use_cache = TRUE) # Display only a brief summary of the data summary(ad_df) #> <ohvbd.ad.matrix> #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2020-01-01 -> 2025-12-31 (2192) #> Locations: 256 print(ad_df) head(rownames(ad_df)) #> [1] "Aruba"       "Afghanistan" "Angola"      "Anguilla"    "Åland"       #> [6] "Albania" head(colnames(ad_df)) #> [1] "2020-01-01" "2020-01-02" "2020-01-03" "2020-01-04" "2020-01-05" #> [6] "2020-01-06" ad_df["Angola", "2020-01-01"] #> [1] 29.33611

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: Multiple places extract data can also provided vector places: can combined date filters create restrictive extraction:
code: ad_df |> glean_ad(   targetdate = "2020-01-01",   places = c("Angola", "Latvia", "United Kingdom") ) #> <ohvbd.ad.matrix> #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2020-01-01 -> 2020-01-01 (1) #> Locations: 3  #> Data: #>                2020-01-01 #> Angola          29.336107 #> Latvia           1.765062 #> United_Kingdom   5.113141 #> attr(,"metric") #> [1] "temp" #> attr(,"gid") #> [1] 0 #> attr(,"cached") #> [1] FALSE #> attr(,"db") #> [1] "ad" #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "ohvbd.ad.matrix" "matrix"          "array" ad_df |> glean_ad(   targetdate = "2020-01-01",   enddate = "2020-01-04",   places = c("Angola", "Latvia", "United Kingdom") ) #> <ohvbd.ad.matrix> #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2020-01-01 -> 2020-01-03 (3) #> Locations: 3  #> Data: #>                2020-01-01 2020-01-02 2020-01-03 #> Angola          29.336107  28.775145  28.883123 #> Latvia           1.765062   3.268600   2.733880 #> United_Kingdom   5.113141   8.206171   6.198989 #> attr(,"metric") #> [1] "temp" #> attr(,"gid") #> [1] 0 #> attr(,"cached") #> [1] FALSE #> attr(,"db") #> [1] "ad" #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "ohvbd.ad.matrix" "matrix"          "array"

title: Sourcing climatic data from AREAdata
text: glean_ad() function also relatively resilient use dates places AREAdata:
code: ad_df |> glean_ad(   targetdate = "2023-12-30",   enddate = "2024-01-02",   places = c("Atlantis", "Latvia", "United Kingdom") ) #> <ohvbd.ad.matrix> #> Areadata matrix for temp at gid level 0 . #> Cached: FALSE  #> Dates: 2023-12-30 -> 2024-01-01 (3) #> Locations: 2  #> Data: #>                2023-12-30 2023-12-31 2024-01-01 #> United_Kingdom   7.007509   7.715774   7.124182 #> Latvia           4.098629  -2.789258  -7.665634 #> attr(,"metric") #> [1] "temp" #> attr(,"gid") #> [1] 0 #> attr(,"cached") #> [1] FALSE #> attr(,"db") #> [1] "ad" #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "ohvbd.ad.matrix" "matrix"          "array"

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: ohvbd R package retrieving (parsing) data network disease vector data sources. package developed part One Health Vector-Borne Diseases Hub.

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: ohvbd allows searching retrieval data following data sources: vbdhub (search ) VecTraits VecDyn GBIF AreaData

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: can install development version ohvbd GitHub : vignettes available online, like build locally, add build_vignettes = TRUE install_github() command. However, recommend due number extra R packages utilised vignettes.

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: ohvbd designed make finding retrieving data disease vectors simple straightforward. Typically uses “piped”-style approach find, get, filter data supported databases, however aims provide data “-”, leaving downstream analysis filtering . basic pipeline finding retrieving data Ixodes ricinus VecTraits database looks something like :
code: library(ohvbd)  df <- search_hub("Ixodes ricinus") |>   filter_db("vt") |>   fetch() |>   glean()

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: includes new functionality specifying searches using spatial extent polygons generally intelligent search behaviour. New function generate_vt_template() quickly generates VecTraits template later upload. See changelog patch notes versions.

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
text: data source data bind AREAdata . must contain decimal lonlat data! areadata AREAdata bind, usually fetch_ad(). targetdate ONE following: date search ISO 8601 (e.g. "2020", "2021-09", "2022-09-21"). start date range dates. character vector fully specified dates search (.e. "yyyy-mm-dd"). enddate (exclusive) end range dates search . unfilled, targetdate searched . gid spatial scale retrieve (0 = country-level, 1=province-level...). (Note: preferentially use gid level areadata present.) lonlat_names vector containing column names longitude latitude columns ORDER! cache_location path cache location (defaults user directory obtained tools::R_user_dir()). basereq url AREAdata database (usually generated ad_basereq()). NA, uses default.

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
text: matrix data added columns extracted areadata.

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
text: date range partially open interval. say lower bound (targetdate) inclusive, upper bound (enddate) exclusive. example date range "2020-08-04" - "2020-08-12" return 7 days 4th 11th August, 12th.

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
text: cases full date provided, earliest date possible available data chosen. "2020-04" internally become "2020-04-01". incomplete date specified targetdate enddate specified, range search inferred minimum temporal scale provided targetdate. example "2020-04" taken mean month April 2020, enddate internally set "2020-05-01".

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad

title: Associate other data sources with AREAdata data — assoc_ad
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() vtdf <- search_hub("Aedes aegypti", "vt") |>   tail(20) |>   fetch() |>   glean(cols = c(     "DatasetID",     "Latitude",     "Longitude",     "Interactor1Genus",     "Interactor1Species"     ), returnunique = TRUE) areadata <- fetch_ad(metric="temp", gid=2, use_cache=TRUE) ad_extract_working <- assoc_ad(vtdf, areadata,                                     targetdate = c("2021-08-04"), enddate=c("2021-08-06"),                                     gid=2, lonlat_names = c("Longitude", "Latitude")) }

title: ohvbd (development version)
text: Major API change means tidyverse loaded ohvbd, direct namespace collisions. Full list function name changes: extract() -> glean() extract_ad() -> glean_ad() extract_gbif() -> glean_gbif() extract_vd() -> glean_vd() extract_vt() -> glean_vt() fetch_extract_vd_chunked() -> fetch_glean_vd_chunked() fetch_extract_vt_chunked() -> fetch_glean_vt_chunked() New functions & arguments: New *_gbif functions (e.g. fetch_gbif()) allow retrieving extracting data GBIF. GBIF account rgbif package required retrieve data GBIF. account details must also set shown rgbif documentation. definitely useful ohvbd workflows, can used base R pipeline (|>). tested magrittr pipelines work -. New filter_db() command allows filtering one database’s results hub searches. check_db_status() now returns (invisibly) whether databases . (default) possibly redownload parts data columns currently present. New force_db() function enables one force ohvbd consider particular object particular provenance. match , filter_db() now transparently return ohvbd.ids objects gets . New taxonomy argument search_hub() allows filtering searches GBIF backbone IDs. New match_species() function allows quick flexible matching species names GBIF backbone IDs. New match_country() function allows matching country names WKT polygons via naturalearth. New ohvbd_db(), has_db(), is_from() functions allow quick testing object provenance (according ohvbd). New get_default_ohvbd_cache() function allows custom functions interface cached ohvbd data files. result, clean_ad_cache() removed now unnecessary. search_x_smart() functions can now take "tags" search field, enabling support tagged datasets. : Entire code base now continuously formatted using Air v0.7.1. Examples longer wrapped \dontrun{} runnable installed version package. good chunk functional logic ohvbd now covered unit tests (using vcr package). fetch_vd() longer tries retrieve ids pages data. errors longer expected occur interfacing vectorbyte. Occasionally users use forget fetch() command run search_hub() |> glean() didn’t previously give interpretable error. Vignettes now use vcr massively reduce build time. matter developers ohvbd, users download github build vignettes . ohvbd.ids() now warns fixes problem provide ids duplicate values. intended encourage preserve least one means retrieving citation data later. WKT parsing formatting now significantly robust. Cached AREAData now includes cache timestamp attribute rather separate variable cache file. glean_ad() now correctly returns matrix even 1 row column. gadm spatial files now cached GeoPackage rather shapefiles, leading >50% speedup loading! (Thanks @josiah.rs bluesky suggestion!) see particular improvements trying retrieve 10 ids one go repeatedly running download code day. speedup also applies fetch_vd() hood, particularly running multiple times day. Explicit term checking (fetch_ad() metrics search_vt_smart() operators fields) now fuzzy, allowing small amount deviation actual term name. assoc_ad() now tries guess LatLong column names none (wrong ones) provided. Errors internal functions now make clear user-facing functions originate .

title: ohvbd 0.6.1
text: includes new functionality specifying searches using spatial extent polygons generally intelligent search behaviour. New function generate_vt_template() quickly generates VecTraits template later upload.

title: ohvbd 0.6.0
text: Internally ohvbd now uses base R pipes (|>). magrittr pipe (%>%) longer used internally, exported use. httr2 v1.1.1 deprecated pool argument req_perform_parallel() broke fetch() commands across ohvbd. now rewritten using new max_active argument, simplify everything bit. change bump required version httr2 v1.1.1.

title: ohvbd 0.5.2
text: fetch_ad() now searches retrieves --date GID2 files AREAdata. New timeout parameter fetch_ad() control timeouts AD downloads. Defaults 4 minutes. assoc_ad() now correctly extracts data (functionality regressed 0.5.0 consequence new dynamic method dispatch approach data retrieval). assoc_ad() also gives now consistent output even 1-dimensional output returned extract_ad() fetch_ functions now default connections argument 2, leading faster retrieval across board. check_src argument removed functions. longer serves much purpose due sanity checking changes implemented 0.5.0.

title: ohvbd 0.5.1
text: fetch_vd() now correctly returns data datasets 50 rows. fetch_vd() also now tells much data retrieving coarse estimate long take. New function fetch_vd_counts() allows quick checking dataset sizes. important datasets VecDyn 40,000 rows long! fetch_ functions (thus also fetch()) now use parallel data retrieval, even 1 connection used. seems lead 20% gain download speed cost.

title: ohvbd 0.5.0
text: find_ functions retrieve metadata column definitions ids. fetch_ functions retrieve actual datasets. side effect longer falsely triggering data continuity checks fetch_ functions indexing output find_x_ids() functions. can now write code find_vt_ids() |> fetch() |> extract() without remember correct extractor use. can still use specific extractor functions desire. major functions interfacing AD, VD, VT output one classes. Cached data AD now contains attribute signify cached. New classes subclassed base R classes, mostly behave way (.e. can subset ohvbd.data.frame way just subsetting normal df). New function ohvbd.ids() allows users create objects S3 class output find_ search_ functions. New is_cached() function enables simple check see object loaded cache ohvbd.

what: Full list of function name changes:
title: ohvbd 0.5.0
text: get_ad() -> fetch_ad() get_extract_vd_chunked() -> fetch_extract_vd_chunked() get_extract_vt_chunked() -> fetch_extract_vt_chunked() get_gadm_sfs() -> fetch_gadm_sfs() get_vd() -> fetch_vd() get_vt() -> fetch_vt() get_vd_columns() -> find_vd_columns() get_vd_current_ids() -> find_vd_ids() get_vt_current_ids() -> find_vt_ids()

title: ohvbd 0.4.4
text: New function check_ohvbd_config() allows easy printing current status ohvbd’s options. New clean_ad_cache() function enables users clean cached AREAdata files easily. Build timings now appear vignettes. Cli outputs now suppressed running vignettes non-interactive mode (e.g. knitting). Default cache path now user directory (obtained tools::R_user_dir()). use-areadata vignette now part content complete. Generally update setting stage another major API overhaul 0.5.0.

title: ohvbd 0.4.3
text: Large changes vb get_ search_ function error handling functions now check automatically SSL issues, recommend set_ohvbd_compat() detected. get_ calls requesting 10 ids run pre-flight ssl check attempting whole thing. get_vd() get_vt() now also return list ids missing curl errors found process trying get data.

title: ohvbd 0.4.2
text: set_ohvbd_compat() now asks user confirmation interactive mode. makes running linux little annoying, worth due seriousness disabling SSL identity verification. asked R session running batch mode, knittr, testthat. retrieving-data vignette now enables compatibility mode running linux. Generally best keep package usage set_ohvbd_compat() absolute minimum. Copyright holder now listed DESCRIPTION

title: ohvbd 0.4.1
text: New parallel downloading options get_x() get_extract_x() functions. used caution, put significantly load server sequential run . New argument check_src allows toggling id-sanity checking functions. retrieving-data vignette now contains instructions use search_x_smart().

title: ohvbd 0.4.0
text: Major simplification function names! get_x_byid() -> get_x() extract_x_data() -> extract_x() assoc_x_y() -> assoc_x() get_extract_x_byid_chunked() -> get_extract_x_chunked() breaks PREVIOUS CODE! Naming now follows logical scheme verb_target_modifier(). example get_x_y() functions always retrieve data database x y specifying special type data. Similarly extract_x() functions always extract data. function multiple things, may get multiple verbs separated underscores, e.g. get_extract_x_chunked() Pipelines now internally attempt confirm data integrity checking correct functions piped together. means longer easy accidentally something like get_vd_current_ids() |> get_vt().

title: ohvbd 0.3.1
text: New function format_time_overlap_bar() allows visually formatting range dates combined another set target dates see overlaps take place. mostly used error handling extract_ad() however can also used independently. designed fill general role within UI design using cli package, usable (hackable) others needing tool. extract_ad() now errors targetdate entries outside range AREAdata dataset. New assoc_ad() associates arbitrary data including lon/lat columns AREAdata. New get_vd_columns() provides quick reference currently present VecDyn columns. (currently possible VecTraits, feasibility investigated.) New assoc_gadm() function associates gadm ids spatial scales arbitrary data include lon/lat columns. Documentation now correctly displays favicons. Logo now rotates variety colourschemes according version number.

title: ohvbd 0.3.0
text: *_basereq() calls longer required first argument functions. , data downloads longer need start vb_basereq() |>. Basereq can now overridden providing alternative basereq basereq argument functions, can generated using vb_basereq(). usually needed using argument unsafe = TRUE vb_basereq(). also possible set ohvbd use compatability-mode ssl calls using set_ohvbd_compat(). change breaks code written prior version, major rewrites may required.

title: ohvbd 0.2.5

title: ohvbd 0.2.4

title: ohvbd 0.2.3

title: ohvbd 0.2.2

title: ohvbd 0.2.1

title: ohvbd 0.2.0

New check_db_status() allows easy checking online status various data providers. ohvbd now interfaces AREAdata repository historical climate data. includes functions get filter AREAdata datasets different spatial scales.
